intro: Symphonia globulifera var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed African ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its dense, dark green leaves and small, clustered flowers that develop into hard, woody fruits. The tree has a thick, buttressed trunk and can grow up to 20 meters tall, making it a prominent feature in its native habitat. Its bark is highly valued for its durability and has been used traditionally for various purposes. The plant is also notable for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, contributing to its ecological significance in forest ecosystems.
